p: Valomaciclovir (EPB-348) is a prodrug that has undergone the preliminary stages of clinical trials for the inhibition of viral DNA polymerase. This ester nucleoside analogue is rapidly converted to omaciclovir (H2G) in vivo and subsequently converted by viral enzymes into the phosphorylated form that binds to VZV polymerase. In vitro studies have shown its activity against HSV-1 and VZV ( Abele et al., 1991). Valomaciclovir was under phase 2 clinical trials for EBV-infectious mononucleosis (NCT00575185) as well as for the treatment of herpes zoster (NCT00831103).
